<i>name</i><br><ol><li>Aquitaine</li></o:
character
  1. Written on a letter, usually a vowel, in place of an omitted n or m.

prep
  1. (16th century onwards) Alternative form of a: at; to

character
  1. The letter a with a tilde. Used to replace the sequence an or am

character
  1. The letter o with a tilde. Used to replace the sequence on or om.

character
  1. The letter i with a tilde. Used to replace the sequence in or im.

noun
  1. household management

adj
  1. domestic; relating to the upkeep of a household

character
  1. The letter u with a tilde. Used to replace the sequence un or um.

character
  1. typographical variant of s, typically used for all instances except a final -s

character
  1. The letter e with a tilde. Used to replace the sequence en or em.
